greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = log_2(A046644(n)); also the 2-adic valuation of A046644(n).
comment: A268375 gives numbers n for which a(n) = A289617(n) = A005187(A001222(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 08 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65536
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: Additive with a(p^n) = A005187(n). - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 08 2017
program: A046643perA046644(n) = { my(c=1); if(1==n,c,fordiv(n,d, if((d>1)&&(d<n), c -= (A046643perA046644(d)*A046643perA046644(n/d)))); (c/2)); } \\ After the Maple-program given in A046643.
A046645(n) = vecsum(apply(e -> A005187(e), factorint(n)[, 2])); \\ A faster implementation. - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 08 2017
xref: See A046643, A046644 for more details.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
